top_categories.workout_context: SBT GRVL’s famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Racing SBT GRVL isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.

SBT GRVL’s famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
SBT GRVL rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 108 miles, SBT GRVL punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at SBT GRVL when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of SBT GRVL. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at SBT GRVL — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at SBT GRVL — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude.
Every session at SBT GRVL intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
SBT GRVL’s 8,189ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what SBT GRVL’s famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for SBT GRVL’s 108 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: SBT GRVL with 8,189ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at SBT GRVL requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 108 miles of famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude in Steamboat Springs, Colorado.
